node.title: Australia effectively locked in to host Rugby World Cup in 2027
node.description: The World Rugby Council will vote again to confirm the decision next year, but Australia is effectively locked in to host the men's tournament in 2027.

node.title: UK politicians outraged by ban on infants in parliament
node.description: British politicians demand a change in rules after a parliamentarian is told she cannot bring her three-month-old son into the House of Commons.

node.title: Former England captain Michael Vaughan axed from BBC's Ashes coverage after racism allegations
node.description: Michael Vaughan strongly denies making racist comments to a number of Asian players in 2009, and says he is "looking forward" to joining Fox Cricket's commentary team for this summer's Ashes series.

node.title: Government nearly loses vote on federal ICAC debate, is saved by COVID technicality
node.description: The Coalition manages to stop a crossbench attempt to bring on debate about a national anti-corruption commission, after government MP Bridget Archer crosses the floor.

node.title: Alleged sex 'cult' leader hit with 18 new charges, court hears
node.description: An alleged sex "cult" leader from northern NSW faces 18 new charges, a court has heard, including sexual intercourse without consent, assault occasioning actual bodily harm.

node.title: Youth Hostel Association to close its hostels after 89 years
node.description: YHA said the the extended Auckland lockdown and no prospects of an international visitors this summer left it an unsustainable financial position.

node.title: More than 30 dead after migrant boat capsizes in English Channel
node.description: It was the worst loss of life on record involving migrants in the narrow stretch of water.

node.title: Shelter lets people foster animals over the holidays
node.description: Some of the foster animals are finding a permanent home.

node.title: A judge will decide if the men convicted of murdering Ahmaud Arbery ever get a chance at parole.
node.description: But under Georgia law, all three men must get sentenced to life in prison.

node.title: NFL, NBA & NHL Thanksgiving Schedule: Full List of Sports to Watch Over the Weekend
node.description: Once you've finished your Thanksgiving traditions, there's dozens of football, hockey and basketball games available to watch on TV this Thanksgiving weekend.

node.title: DOJ Says Alabama Has Yet to Fix Its Prisons Where 33 Inmates Have Died in Last 3 Years
node.description: The United States lawsuit against Alabama claimed the state's prison conditions are so bad they violate the constitution's ban on cruel and unusual punishment.

node.title: Gray Wolf That Trekked 935 Miles From Oregon to California Found Dead Near Roadway
node.description: The first gray wolf to be documented in Southern California since the 1920s was found dead.

node.title: Feds Will Act Swiftly to Prosecute Airline Passengers Who Misbehave, Get Violent
node.description: The FAA has initiated nearly 1,000 investigations into passenger conduct this year, the highest by far since they started keeping track in 1995.

node.title: Massachusetts Lawmakers Approve Bill on Holocaust Education Amid Rise in Antisemitism
node.description: If enacted, a Genocide Education Trust Fund would be made under the bill to help create teaching materials and give training for educators.

node.title: Dem Lawmaker Says 'Buck Stops With the President' on Gas Prices as White House Dodges Blame
node.description: On Tuesday, Energy Secretary Jennifer Granholm told reporters, "The president does not control the price of gasoline. No president does."

node.title: Timeline: Chronicling Recent Smash-and-Grab Robberies in LA, Bay Area Amid Crime Spike
node.description: Many of the reported thefts have involved dozens of people who broke into stores and stole items while traveling in groups.

node.title: Meet the man who sold his house to buy a record press
node.description: Neil Wilson is pinning his hopes on the "strong energy" of Brisbane's music scene and music lovers' passion for vinyl as he jumps into the record business.

node.title: 'I'm still stunned': Ancient mammoth tusk found 3km under the sea
node.description: Researchers recover an ancient mammoth tusk, thought to be over 100,000 years old, three kilometres under the sea off the central coast of California.

node.title: 'Recognising infant loss starts in our workplace': Push for paid miscarriage leave for public servants
node.description: Donna Penny has endure two miscarriages and given birth to a stillborn son. Now she is joining growing calls for the ACT government to legislate a paid leave scheme for public servants who experienced miscarriage or stillbirth.

node.title: Tom Hardy's loveable monster returns in a scrappy sequel smart enough to play totally dumb
node.description: The first Venom was panned, but Andy Serkis’s sequel is unapologetically juvenile - with comedic banter, gross-out effects and epic CGI clashes. It’s also surprisingly tender.

node.title: Jetstar pilot held over missing campers case enters third day in custody without charge
node.description: Today marks the third day a Jetstar pilot has been held in custody by authorities without a charge in connection with the disappearance of campers Russell Hill and Carol Clay, who went missing in Victoria's High Country last year.

node.title: Today is expected to be the peak of what has already been a thoroughly drenching system
node.description: There is still more rain to come for the soggy east coast, but it is finally looking like there could be a bit of a break next week.

node.title: Queensland Premier confirms border bubble being considered amid Byron Bay COVID scare
node.description: Annastacia Palaszczuk says the Queensland government is "looking at that border bubble" for when the state reaches a 80 per cent double vaccination target but a COVID-19 case in Byron Bay needs close consideration.

node.title: Spy bosses step out of the shadows in unprecedented move
node.description: For decades the existence of Australia's overseas spy agency ASIS was officially a secret, and no employee of the covert organisation except for its director-general was allowed to be identified publicly — until now.

node.title: Small business sales rise despite Covid-19 uncertainty and mental toll
node.description: Small businesses are seeing improvements in sales, jobs and waited less time for invoices to be paid.

node.title: Vaccine pass helpline swamped by calls as thousands eye traffic-light travel
node.description: Long waits, cut-offs, and unanswered messages are leaving callers to the Covid-19 vaccine pass helpline helpless.

node.title: Building consent demands cause delays in Dunedin
node.description: The Dunedin City Council is asking for patience as its building services team struggles with a boom in building consents.

node.title: ‘It’s good to see racism lose’: Guilty verdicts are hailed in the Arbery case.
node.description: The murder convictions of three white men in the death of Ahmaud Arbery were praised by many as a just outcome in a case that could have stoked racial divisions.

node.title: The royal family is in a dispute with the BBC. This is why
node.description: The British royal family issues a rare joint statement claiming a BBC documentary titled The Princes and the Press makes "overblown and unfounded claims". Here's why.

node.title: Starring Louise Erdrich as Herself
node.description: In her new best seller, “The Sentence,” the veteran novelist plays a small but important role as her protagonist’s benevolent boss.

node.title: Canned or Fresh Cranberry Sauce? Americans Are Divided
node.description: A new survey suggests that although about one in three Americans do not like cranberry sauce, those who do like the Thanksgiving condiment are divided.

node.title: Critics Say $9B Houston Highway Project Racially Unjust, Will Impact Diverse Neighborhoods
node.description: Increased pollution, displacement, and flooding could trouble Black and Latino residents if the project comes to fruition, critics say.

node.title: What’s in Our Queue? ‘The Show of Shows’ and More
node.description: I'm a senior staff editor on the Culture desk. Here are five things I've been watching, reading and sifting through.

node.title: 'Accountability for Hate': Progressive Politicians React to Guilty Verdict in Ahmaud Arbery Case
node.description: "This guilty verdict is a step toward justice that Ahmaud and his family deserve," California Representative Jimmy Gomez tweeted.

node.title: When Is the Macy's Thanksgiving Parade? 2021 Date, Route and Schedule
node.description: New York City's annual parade will allow in-person viewings this year after being closed to spectators in 2020 due to the coronavirus pandemic.

node.title: Indiana Extends COVID State of Emergency After Lawmakers Stall Anti-Mandate Bill
node.description: The bill would require businesses to accept COVID vaccine exemptions, and will no longer be debated on November 29 due to the lack of action.

node.title: Australia Adds U.S.-Based Neo-Nazi Group to List of Banned Terrorist Organizations
node.description: The Base, a neo-nazi group, was formed in the United States in 2018. The Base is the second far-right group to make Australia's list of banned organizations.

node.title: Fed Acknowledges Inflation Greater Than Expected, Plans for Possible Long-Term Effects
node.description: Minutes released Wednesday of the Federal Reserve's November 2-3 meeting revealed officials discussing inflation, and what the central bank could do to help.

node.title: Montana Must Pay 13-Year-Old $16M for Failure to Investigate Abuse That Left Her Blind
node.description: "This is an important moment for our client and represents a measure of justice for her," one of the girl's lawyers said in a statement.

node.title: 'It does make me worry': Candice Warner calls out Cricket Australia over Tim Paine scandal
node.description: Candice Warner reveals why she is worried about Cricket Australia's call on Tim Paine's position in the Test team after he resigned as captain.

node.title: Simon Bridges: 'What we saw yesterday was truly desperate stuff from Judith Collins'
node.description: After his shock demotion, Bridges says Collins will go to any length to hold on to her leadership of the National Party. Audio

node.title: Solomon Islands PM calls for calm after looting and protests
node.description: Authorities are calling for calm and accountability in Solomon Islands, after political protests developed into looting and buildings were burned in the capital Honiara.

node.title: Kiwis stranded in Australia eager to return home as MIQ restrictions ease
node.description: Stuck for months in a motorhome in Queensland, Sue Norton and her husband now have a firm date for returning home.

node.title: Most Connecticut cities reach state's red alert for COVID infections
node.description: Sixty-five percent of Connecticut's 169 cities and towns are now in the red alert level, the state's highest of four levels for COVID-19 infections, according to state data released Wednesday.

node.title: California Regulators Approve Fewer Fracking Permits Due to Climate Change Concerns
node.description: The Western States Petroleum Association and Kern County, where a majority of the state's fracking happens, filed lawsuits due to the lack of granted permits.

node.title: Former Delta Sigma Theta Executive Stole $228,000 From Sorority, Gets 16 Months
node.description: Husband and wife are sentenced in the embezzlement of $228,000 from Delta Sigma Theta Sorority.

node.title: Salvation Army's Donors Withdraw Support in Response to Racial 'Wokeness' Initiative
node.description: Following the incorporation of a new "woke" initiative into its curriculum, some Salvation Army officers and donors are withdrawing their support.

node.title: Accused unruly passengers face fines and arrests
node.description: The FAA has requested another $160,000 in fines and the attorney general wants to prioritize prosecutions for crimes on flights.

node.title: Pandemic fueling surge in organized thefts at stores across U.S.
node.description: An increase in online shopping during the pandemic has also created a bigger marketplace for sellers of stolen goods.

node.title: Off-Duty Cop Fatally Struck Pedestrian, Took Body Home to Mother for Advice: Prosecutor
node.description: The officer was identified as 25-year-old Louis Santiago, according to the Essex County Prosecutor's Office.

node.title: CDC Report Indicates U.S. Abortions Increasing, But Large Swath of National Data Missing
node.description: The CDC reported a slight uptick in abortions since 2018, but are hesitant to make any sweeping statements with data from California missing.

node.title: Builders, Investors Cashing in on Red-Hot Rental Market as Home Prices Climb
node.description: Builders began construction on 16,000 single-family homes slated to become rentals in the third quarter, the highest quarterly total since at least 1990.

node.title: After Pool Disaster, Heartbroken Great-Grandma Receives $90,000 Surprise
node.description: "Just no words. There aren't words big enough to thank everyone. I'm just so thankful," she said.

node.title: PM urged to protect gay students, teachers as he prepares to introduce religious discrimination bill
node.description: The Prime Minister will say the proposed law will protect religious Australians against "cancel culture". However, he is also being urged to act immediately to ensure gay students and teachers cannot be fired or expelled.

node.title: Govt relying on 'goodwill and honesty' of travellers to do self-isolation
node.description: The mandatory self-isolation period for all people arriving in New Zealand from mid-January will be monitored with a light touch, Covid-19 Response Minister Chris Hipkins says. Audio

node.title: Nasa Dart rocket: Mission to smack Dimorphos asteroid launches

node.title: In the Arbery killing trial, video evidence once again played a crucial role.
node.description: The ubiquity of footage from bystanders and police officers has elevated videos to the center of many recent trials.

node.title: Surveys suggest violence against women has intensified during the pandemic, a U.N. report says.
node.description: Almost half of the women who were surveyed said that they or a woman they knew had experience violence since the start of the outbreak.

node.title: Unvaccinated Italians' Movements Restricted in Effort to Prevent Another COVID Lockdown
node.description: New measures announced Wednesday by Prime Minister Mario Draghi require proof of vaccination or COVID recovery for several indoor events as cases rise in Italy.

node.title: Pac Bell to Pay $1.5M to Remove Lead-Leaking Telephone Cables from Lake Tahoe

node.title: NFL, Los Angeles Rams Owner to Pay $790M to St. Louis for Relocating Team
node.description: NFL officials and St. Louis representatives "have been able to fully resolve" a more than 4-year dispute over the Rams' relocation to Los Angeles.

node.title: Woman Confronts Gymgoer Who Allegedly Called Her a 'Dumb C**t' in Viral Video

node.title: SA Health lists new COVID exposure sites
node.description: SA Health lists new exposure sites related to a positive COVID-19 case, including a Qantas flight that arrived in Adelaide on Wednesday morning.

node.title: Victoria records 1,254 new COVID-19 cases and five deaths as state hits 90pc double vaccination threshold
node.description: Victoria reaches its target of 90 per cent full vaccination for those aged 12 and over. There are 10,276 active COVID-19 cases in the state.

node.title: Methven's new Ōpuke Pools opened

node.title: A new republic is born: Barbados celebrates ditching Britain's queen
node.description: Barbados, a former British colony, will next week ditch Queen Elizabeth as head of state, breaking its last remaining imperial bonds with Britain nearly 400 years since the first English ship arrived…

node.description: “Supposedly it’s the largest animal-made structure visible from space. I would like to write about it myself, but no editors are interested.”

node.title: Oxford, Collins Dictionaries Pick Vax, NFT as 2021 Words of the Year
node.description: NFT is an abbreviation for non-fungible token. The term vax can be used as a noun or verb and is the root for other common phrases such as "getting vaxed."

node.title: What's driving 'phenomenal' demand for Gold Coast properties?
node.description: They're called 'VESPAs' — Virus Escapees Seeking Provincial Australia — and they are helping to make rental affordability in the Gold Coast "one of the worst" in the country.

node.description: The Education Review Office has warned that a rapid increase in enrolments by at-risk students is stretching the Correspondence School, Te Kura.

node.title: San Francisco Water Customers Asked to Reduce Consumption or Pay Surcharge

node.title: Michigan Football Coach Statue Vandalized With Message Supporting Sexual Assault Victims
node.description: Red paint was splattered across the statue, and the message "Bo knew #hailtothevictims" was written in black on the steps.

node.title: Arbery Jury Shows 'System Can Work Even in Sensitive and Dramatic Cases': Former Prosecutor
node.description: "The country can have confidence that the jury spoke in a unanimous voice of accountability based on the evidence," Michael McAuliffe told Newsweek.

node.title: Mole selfies could help detect skin cancers early. But be 'wary' of AI apps
node.description: Sending smartphone photos of your suspicious moles and lesions to a dermatologist could be a feasible way to monitor for melanomas, a study finds.

node.title: Canada becomes first country to fully approve Johnson & Johnson vaccine
node.description: The full authorization makes Canada the first country to do so for Johnson & Johnson's COVID vaccine.

node.title: Margo Guryan, Whose Album Drew Belated Acclaim, Dies at 84
node.description: She recorded “Take a Picture” in 1968, but it died when she declined to tour. Three decades later, adventurous listeners discovered it and gave it a new life.

node.title: JPMorgan CEO 'Regrets' Joke Company Would Last Longer Than China's Communist Party
node.description: "It's never right to joke about or denigrate any group of people," Jamie Dimon said after joking about longevity at a Boston College event.

node.title: International language sector says border reopening date for students too late
node.description: The government's decision to let vaccinated foreign students back into the country from 30 April has disappointed and frustrated some in the international education sector.

node.title: I’m Feeling Optimistic About the Fed
node.description: Jay Powell and Lael Brainard know rising inflation must be addressed, but not at the expense of getting people back to work.

node.title: California Leaders Vow to Crack Down After High-Profile Burglaries
node.description: “Their plan was to overwhelm us,” Chief Bill Scott of the San Francisco police said after about a dozen stores were stolen from in one night.

node.title: Charlottesville Extremists Lose in Court, but Replacement Theory Lives On
node.description: Organizers of the “Unite the Right” demonstration suffered a damaging legal defeat this week. But four years after the rally, their message has seeped closer to the conservative mainstream.

node.title: 31 Migrants Die in English Channel After Boat Launched from France Capsizes
node.description: British and French authorities have called it the "biggest tragedy" involving immigrants in the crossing.

node.title: 'Lines get blurred between carer and family': why families of those with mental health issues need support
node.description: More than 45 per cent of Australians experience mental illness in their lifetimes, but there's often a shortage of services and support for their families.

node.title: 'He will now rest in peace': Three men found guilty of murder of unarmed black man Ahmaud Arbery in US
node.description: A jury has found three men guilty of the murder of black man Ahmaud Arbery, who was shot while jogging in the US state of Georgia in February 2020.

node.title: Will petrol prices rise above $2 a litre?
node.description: Global oil markets are volatile at the moment, and petrol prices are steadily rising. What will happen to prices this holiday season?

node.title: 'Why can't they come home now?' Opposition decries trans-Tasman delays
node.description: The government's decision to delay home isolation for New Zealanders in Australia until after Christmas is ripping families apart, opposition parties say.
